summary: Something Killing Eve fans will never have to worry about is believability in the Villaneve kisses (when they happen) because...
body: Something Killing Eve fans will never have to worry about is believability in the Villaneve kisses (when they happen) because both Jodie and Sandra DEFINITELY know how to kiss and it shows. They don’t hold back and I don’t know if we’re gonna be able to handle it.

summary: This video is about connection between Villanelle and Eve. Oksana is an Assassin who's killing people worldwide. Eve is trying...
body:
This video is about connection between Villanelle and Eve. Oksana is an Assassin who’s killing people worldwide. Eve is trying to find her. The tension between them is fascinating, you never know how each of them will react. They have love-hate, suspect-cop connection. Here i am trying to show you how complicated their relationship is. If you want to understand them you have to watch whole series cause even if i or somebody else could manage to do movie about them this still wouldn’t be the same tension,vibe as it is on show

Hope you like it!!!

summary: " About Villanelle being totally head over heels for what Eve did to her… I think this could be read as foreshadowing with...
question: " About Villanelle being totally head over heels for what Eve did to her… I think this could be read as foreshadowing with regards to herself as well since Eve is not the only one who does Crazy Things out of love or devotion or obsession." I completey agree, to me we'll see a crazy side of Villanelle that is fueled not only by her usual craziness and recklessness but also by her obsession(love?) and fascination for Eve.....
answer:
HELL YEAH HELL YEAH HELL YEAH HELL YEAH

blog.name: garland-on-thy-brow
blog.title: the brooding drummer who steals fans' hearts
blog.description:
Gene | lesbian | 23 | they/them, she/her, occasionally he/him.

Main topic: Late Roman Republic and its interpretations in fiction. Won't shut up about the portrait of Sempronia. Won't shut up about Bridge Theatre Julius Caesar.

Anthony J. Crowley wrote Shakespeare's Julius Caesar. Veva Blanc is alchemical. Symbrock is Brutecass. Killing Eve is EVErything. Rachel Weisz should play Philippa Eilhart.

[AO3]. Tags, about.

blog.name: morningmightcomebyaccident
blog.title: a convenient distraction
blog.description:
greywing @ lj
ctrlx/greywing @ AO3
Orphan Black fanfic
By following this blog, you agree to be bombarded by long text posts. Have a good day.

summary:
tropicannabooks
 replied to your post  “How did you feel about the bit at the end of ep 2? With Villanelle's...”
               ...
body:
tropicannabooks replied to your post “How did you feel about the bit at the end of ep 2? With Villanelle’s…”

As soon as you mentioned the carrot on the stick, I realized that your right, there’s no way to control villanelle. But I think what this is all leading up to is that Eve will be the only way to control her. The closest relationships we’ve seen villanelle have, have been Constantin and Anna, and she still killed them both. (The fact that Constantin is still alive is irrelevant to this point.) I don’t think Villanelle has ever actually felt what she’s feeling for Eve before.

What have it away was three things. The first, being that she didn’t shoot her when she could have. Villanelle doesn’t hesitate, not for real. She doesn’t hold back and she doesn’t feel remorse. But, she didn’t shoot eve. The second thing is during the season finale, Eve asked, are you going to kill me? And she said no. That’s big. V is always honest. She’s been asked that question before, and she’s always answered honestly. The fact that she said no, makes me believe that she truly cares 

The last thing is the call in the latest episode. She called her when she had no one else. This is V. The last person she wants to show vulnerability to is Eve, and yet that’s the only person who she feels connected to enough to do so. That’s why I think the only way for this season to end would be villanelle being controlled by her love for Eve. Putting them both in considerable danger

I disagree that “Eve will be the only way to control” Villanelle.

Anna killed herself. It’s actually a big question mark as to whether Villanelle could have killed Anna but Anna took the question off the table by taking her own life out of remorse and guilt.

I think Villanelle felt very strongly for Anna and that what she feels for Eve is probably akin to that, heightened with an element of the chase and the knowledge that Eve sees even more parts of her than Anna was capable of seeing and knowing that Eve is drawn to her even though Eve sees those parts. Really, because Eve sees those parts Eve is drawn to Villanelle, though perhaps not for the reasons/motivations that Villanelle thinks. That last part is important because we are shown time and again that Villanelle’s logic doesn’t draw the same conclusions that the majority of people. In ways, she is more out of control when she believes she’s doing something for someone’s “benefit”: killing Anna’s husband, killing Bill for Eve, killing Gabriel. Villanelle doesn’t understand why none of those deeds were received gratefully. I’d actually forgotten until recently that Villanelle considered the nice clothes she gave Eve as fair exchange for the loss of Bill. Only with Gabriel’s death–the “mercy” kill–was there no real direct benefit to Villanelle. (I guess she got to stage a message to Eve, but that wasn’t the primary reason she killed Gabriel, as opposed to offing Anna’s husband in order to take away any competition for affection. Perhaps something similar with Bill, too.)

I don’t think anything or anyone can “control” Villanelle. She acts on her own, most often for her own interests to satisfy her own needs–and her attempts at empathy come from a place wherein how she understands her own desires don’t match up with most people’s desires and thus trying to project her interests as those of others means that she does things incomprehensible to everyone around her. It’s logical to Villanelle but not to anyone else–and it’s that divide that means that she can’t be managed in any predictable way. 

Also freedom–to be free, to be able to act freely, to be autonomous–is important to Villanelle and I can’t see her submitting to anyone. Technically she’s subordinate to the wishes of the organization, but we’ve seen how well that plays out, i.e. once Villanelle’s priorities and the organization’s priorities don’t align, Villanelle’s priorities take precedence.

I truly don’t think Villanelle can be leashed in any form that doesn’t originate from herself. Even Eve using some influence would take a form of manipulation on Eve’s part to convince Villanelle to act in certain ways and I’m not sure that’s doable… Villanelle is too much her own creature, that’s why she started to act out and show off in her murders. I don’t know if we, as viewers, want to see her leashed in any way, either. It wouldn’t be her?

summary: Do you think "Elizabeth" is afraid of ghosts? Or is it actually Villanelle ?
question: Do you think "Elizabeth" is afraid of ghosts? Or is it actually Villanelle ?
answer:
i think in that moment the villanelle popped out a little bit. julian’s mother scared the shit out of her, so when she says she hates ghosts, i think she means it.

it’s probably a tease on emerald’s part, and i love it.

i think in that moment the villanelle popped out a little bit. julian’s mother scared the shit out of her, so when she says she hates ghosts, i think she means it.

it’s probably a tease on emerald’s part, and i love it.

blog.name: villaneveee
blog.description: A blog dedicated to the show Killing Eve and Villaneve

tags: i also love how much attention to detail there is in the first place
summary: I don't know if anyone has ever caught this before, but in the Killing Eve S1 finale you can hear sirens right before Eve asks...
question: I don't know if anyone has ever caught this before, but in the Killing Eve S1 finale you can hear sirens right before Eve asks Villanelle if she's going to kill her. It was probably the "paramedics" that were sent to kill Villanelle is S2.
answer: hey woah. that’s a really good catch, anon. now we know that phoebe and emerald definitely pow wowed about the season because i feel like that detail could have easily been ignored

main: youandwhoseamy ♥ AO3: zozo

title: I wrote Killing Eve fanfic?
body:
I wrote two Killing Eve fanfics!

  • all of your lives unled — An alternate ending to 2x02, in which Eve and Carolyn catch up to Villanelle first.
  • some hearts, sometimes, leave blind — Another AU, in which MI6 has recruited Villanelle. She and Eve go on a mission together. Hijinks ensue.

Also, hi. This is my new KE sideblog.
